marketNews.title: The Fed Cuts Interest Rates, US-China Reach New Agreement
marketNews.content: The US central bank, The Fed, on Wednesday (10/29) local time decided to cut the US interest rate by -25 bps to the range of 3.75-4%, in line with consensus expectations. This marks The Fed's 2nd consecutive rate cut amid concerns over the weakening US labor market. Nevertheless, the Chairman of The Fed, Jerome Powell, stated that the committee does not guarantee further US interest rate cuts in the next meeting in December 2025. This is due to the hindered release process of the latest US economic data caused by the government shutdown since early October 2025, as well as still high US inflation. For context, at last month's meeting, The Fed projected 2 more rate cuts by the end of 2025 to the range of 3.5-3.75%. Besides interest rate policy, The Fed also announced it would halt the shrinkage of its asset portfolio (quantitative tightening) starting December 1, 2025, ending the process that began in 2022, along with liquidity tightening in the money market and declining bank reserves. In separate news, US President Donald Trump said on Thursday (10/30) that he would reduce tariffs on China by 10 percentage points, resulting in total tariffs on China imports falling from 57% to 47%. The announcement was made after Trump met with Chinese President Xi Jinping at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) event in South Korea. Trump also stated that the US had reached an agreement with China that includes several important points: China will not impose drastic restrictions on rare earth minerals exports to the US, China continues soybean imports from the US, and China will crack down on illegal trade of fentanyl precursor compounds to the US. Trump said this agreement will be valid for 1 year and is expected to be renewed annually. Additionally, both parties also discussed access for US-made chips—including AI chips from Nvidia—amid moves by Chinese authorities who previously tightened imports of these chips and encouraged domestic technology companies to switch to local products. Key Takeaway: With inflation as one of the factors The Fed considers in interest rate decisions, we assess that the agreement between the US and China—including tariff reductions—can be a positive development for the US inflation outlook. Nevertheless, when the government shutdown will end remains an uncertainty for the market, so investors need to monitor this. The market itself appears to have priced in expectations of positive developments from the Trump and Xi meeting, reflected in the market reaction being muted with several indices slightly down as of Thursday (10/30) afternoon, such as in Asia (Shanghai Composite -0.73%), Europe (Stoxx 50 -0.50%), and the US (S&P Futures -0.04%).

tickerNews.title: BBRI 9M25: Net Profit -10% YoY, Slightly Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: $BBRI: Bank Rakyat Indonesia recorded net profit of 14.5 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (-6% YoY, +15% QoQ). This result led to a net profit for 9M25 reaching 40.8 trillion rupiah (-10% YoY), slightly below expectations as it equals 72% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. last 2 years' average: 73-75% annual realization). Pre-Provision Operating Profit decreased by -7% YoY/-1% YoY in 3Q25/9M25 along with Non-Interest Income weakening by -15% YoY/-2% YoY amidst Net Interest Income still growing at +3% YoY. The weakening of Non-Interest Income was caused by lower Recovery income of -35% YoY/-14% YoY in 3Q25/9M25. On the other hand, provision expenses declined in 3Q25 (-6% YoY, -6% QoQ), but provision expenses for 9M25 still increased by +14% YoY, thus suppressing net profit.

tickerNews.title: CMRY 9M25: Net Profit +39% YoY, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: $CMRY: Cisarua Mountain Dairy recorded net profit of 607 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+72% YoY, +18% QoQ). This result led to a net profit for 9M25 reaching 1.6 trillion rupiah (+39% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equals 88% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. last 3 years' average: 79% annual realization). The 3Q25 net profit growth was mainly driven by: 1) revenue growth (+23% YoY, +1% QoQ); and 2) operating profit margin expansion to 24.5% (vs. 3Q24: 22.3%, 2Q25: 23.6%). Revenue growth in 3Q25 was supported by both segments of the company, with 'consumer foods' growing strongly (+29% YoY, -9% QoQ) and the 'dairy' segment experiencing improvement (+15% YoY, +19% QoQ). Operating expense growth was relatively moderate compared to revenue, so operating profit in 3Q25 increased to 666 billion rupiah (+34% YoY, +4% QoQ). Net profit growth in 3Q25 was also helped by net financial income reaching 107 billion rupiah (vs. 3Q24: financial expense of 62 billion rupiah, 2Q25: financial income of 17 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: HMSP 9M25: Net Profit -14% YoY, Below Expectations, Recovery Trend Visible in 3Q25
tickerNews.content: $HMSP: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna recorded net profit of 2.4 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: 210 billion rupiah, 3Q24: 1.9 trillion rupiah), recovering from 2Q25 performance which was suppressed by one-off tax expenses. This result led to a net profit for 9M25 reaching 4.5 trillion rupiah (-14% YoY), below expectations as it equals 68% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 79% annual realization). Revenue in 3Q25 still declined by -7% YoY, but this was compensated by an increase in gross profit margin to 20.2% (vs. 3Q24: 16.5%, 2Q25: 17.5%) as a result of no excise tax increase this year, which also raised the operating profit margin to 10.4% (vs. 3Q24: 7.8%, 2Q25: 6.1%). Although the 9M25 net profit performance is below expectations, generally the recovery trend in the financial statements is visible through the quarterly increase in revenue in 3Q25 by +8% QoQ, driven by seasonality effects boosting volume (+7% QoQ) and the beginning of an increase in average selling price (+1% QoQ). This marks the first quarterly increase in the average selling price since 3Q24.

tickerNews.title: WIIM 9M25: Net Profit +37% YoY, Supported by SKM Segment Growth
tickerNews.content: $WIIM: Wismilak Inti Makmur recorded net profit of 137 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+127% YoY, +82% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 9M25 reaching 285 trillion rupiah (+37% YoY). Performance in 3Q25/9M25 was supported by revenue increases of +43% YoY/+34% YoY. Based on segmentation, the Machine Rolled Cigarette (SKM) segment showed the highest growth in 3Q25/9M25 (+73% YoY/+48% YoY), which we attribute to increased volume and also average selling price, referring to 1Q25 data. Meanwhile, WIIM's gross profit margin decreased to 21.7% during 9M25 (vs. 9M24: 22.6%), relatively stable since the beginning of the year. However, the operating profit margin increased to 8.3% during 9M25 (vs. 9M24: 7.6%), the highest since 1H24.

tickerNews.title: BRIS 9M25: Net Profit +9% YoY, In Line with Expectations, CoC Declined in 3Q25
tickerNews.content: $BRIS: Bank Syariah Indonesia recorded net profit of 1.8 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (+7% YoY, -2% QoQ). This result led to a net profit for 9M25 reaching 5.6 trillion rupiah (+9% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 72% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 73%). BRIS's performance was supported by Net Margin Income + Fee Based Income growing by +11% YoY/+14% YoY in 3Q25/9M25. On the other hand, opex continued to increase by +19% YoY/+20% YoY, while provision expenses rose +7% YoY during 9M25 although they fell -15% YoY in 3Q25. CoC in 3Q25/9M25 was at the level of 0.7%/0.9%, down from the level of ~1% in 2Q25/1H25, which is estimated to be the highest point throughout 2025. Meanwhile, financing growth as of September 2025 only reached +13% YoY (vs. June 2025: +14% YoY), below management's 2025 guidance in the range of +14-16% YoY.

tickerNews.title: BNGA 9M25: Net Profit +3% YoY, In Line with Expectations, Record Quarterly Profit in 3Q25
tickerNews.content: $BNGA: Bank CIMB Niaga recorded net profit of 1.8 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (+5% YoY, +10% QoQ), marking a record high quarterly net profit. This result led to a net profit for 9M25 reaching 5.3 trillion rupiah (+3% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 74% of the consensus 2025F (vs. 9M24: 75% annual realization). Net profit performance in 3Q25 was supported by the recovery of Net Interest Margin (NIM) to ≥4% in 3Q25 after being relatively suppressed in the previous 3 quarters, as well as an increase in Non-Interest Income (+25% YoY). On the other hand, loans decreased by -1.4% QoQ in 3Q25, marking the 2nd quarterly loan contraction since 2022. Meanwhile, Cost of Credit (CoC) in 3Q25 jumped above 1%, the highest since 3Q23, causing CoC for 9M25 to rise to 0.9% and slightly exceeding management's revised lower 2025 guidance in the range of 0.6-0.8%.

tickerNews.title: JSMR 9M25: Net Profit -17% YoY, Below Expectations, Driven by Tax Expense Increase
tickerNews.content: $JSMR: Jasa Marga recorded net profit of 857 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-10% YoY, -9% QoQ). This result led to a net profit for 9M25 reaching 2.7 trillion rupiah (-17% YoY), equal to 72% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. 9M24: 73% realization in 2024). The decline in net profit during 9M25 was mainly suppressed by the increase in tax expense to 1.21 trillion rupiah, reversing from a tax benefit of 73 billion rupiah in 9M24. Profit before tax for 9M25 still rose +23% YoY, primarily driven by: 1) a decrease in financial expenses by -17% YoY; and 2) operating profit growth of +5% YoY with a relatively stable operating profit margin at 33% (vs. 9M24: 32%).

tickerNews.title: ERAA 9M25: Net Profit -1% YoY, In Line with Expectations, SSSG Contracted Amid Revenue Growth
tickerNews.content: $ERAA: Erajaya Swasembada recorded net profit of 217 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-19% YoY, +7% QoQ). This result led to a net profit for 9M25 reaching 786 billion rupiah (-1% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 68% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. last 3 years' average: 68% annual realization). Revenue in 3Q25 grew (+12% YoY, +9% QoQ) with 9M25 growing +8% YoY. This growth occurred amidst a Same Store Sales Growth (SSSG) contraction of -1.7% YoY in 9M25 (vs. 1H25: -3.1% YoY). The decline in net profit in 3Q25 was mainly suppressed by an increase in cost of goods sold (+13% YoY, +10% QoQ) and an increase in opex (+13% YoY, +3% QoQ). Gross profit margin was recorded to have dropped to 10.9% (vs. 3Q24: 12.0%, 2Q25: 11.3%). Meanwhile, the increase in opex caused operating profit to contract year-on-year (-5% YoY, +14% QoQ). The increase in opex was driven by expansion—both in ERAA and Sinar Eka Selaras ($ERAL)—and preparation for the launch of the iPhone 17 series products.

tickerNews.title: ERAL 9M25: Net Profit -21% YoY, Driven by Opex Surge Due to Expansion
tickerNews.content: $ERAL: Sinar Eka Selaras recorded net profit of 45 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-33% YoY, +19% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 9M25 reaching 125 billion rupiah (-21% YoY). The decline in year-on-year net profit in 3Q25 was mainly suppressed by a surge in opex (+90% YoY) following the company's expansion, which was reflected in double-digit revenue growth (+28% YoY, +35% QoQ). Revenue growth was supported by Same Store Sales Growth (SSSG) recorded at +13.8% YoY in 9M25 (vs. 1H25: +15.8% YoY). The surge in opex suppressed the operating profit margin in 3Q25 to 4.2% (vs. 3Q24: 5.8%), causing operating profit in 3Q25 to decrease by -8% YoY. ERAL also began recording revenue in a new segment, namely 'automotive', contributing 11% of the total 3Q25 revenue.

tickerNews.title: Other Hot News: DHE SDA Revision, Interim Dividends from SMSM, TSPC, CNMA, MEDC, and Buybacks from TBIG and BBHI
tickerNews.content: Minister Coordinator for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that the government plans to offer more facilities for natural resource exporters as part of the revision of regulations on the placement of foreign exchange earnings from natural resources (DHE SDA). However, Airlangga did not detail the additional facilities to be provided. Airlangga also explained that the government will not expand the DHE placement rules outside the SDA sector. Selamat Sempurna ($SMSM) plans to distribute interim dividends for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to ~230 billion rupiah or 40 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 2.2% as of Thursday (10/30). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 7, 2025, while payment is on November 25, 2025. This is the 3rd interim dividend for SMSM's 2025 fiscal year, after distributing interim dividends of 35 rupiah per share in August 2025 and 25 rupiah per share in May 2025. Tempo Scan Pacific ($TSPC) plans to distribute interim dividends for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to ~451 billion rupiah or 100 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 3.6% as of Thursday (10/30). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 7, 2025, while payment is on November 25, 2025. Nusantara Sejahtera Raya ($CNMA) plans to distribute interim dividends for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to 5 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 4.2% as of Thursday (10/30). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 6, 2025, while payment is on November 28, 2025. Medco Energi Internasional ($MEDC) plans to distribute interim dividends for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to 27.77 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 2.1% as of Thursday (10/30). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 10, 2025, while payment is on November 28, 2025. Tower Bersama Infrastructure ($TBIG) plans to conduct a buyback of up to 158 million (0.7%) shares with a fund allocation of up to ~360 billion rupiah in the period October 30, 2025-January 29, 2026 through PT Ciptadana Sekuritas Asia. This plan does not require GMS approval, in line with the relaxation granted by OJK to support capital market stability. Lippo Cikarang ($LPCK) recorded marketing sales of 1.2 trillion rupiah during 9M25 (+13.7% YoY), equivalent to 73% of the 2025 target of 1.65 trillion rupiah. Of this amount, the landed house segment contributed 60%, followed by the commercial segment (34%) and the industrial land segment (6%). Allo Bank Indonesia ($BBHI) plans to conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to ~119.4 billion rupiah in the period October 30, 2025-January 29, 2026. This plan does not require GMS approval, in line with the relaxation granted by OJK to support capital market stability. The fund allocation in this buyback is the remainder from the buyback fund allocation in the periods April 30-July 29, 2025 and July 30-October 29, 2025.
